page.title: 15A DAIRY FARM,SOMERFORD AREA
page.content: Brook Farm,like most modern farms, has made use of modern technology.They have installed two computers,one in the milking parlour and one in the main office.The one in the milking parlour controls the exact amount of food each cow should be given and the one in the office keeps a record of the history of each animal.They have worked out that it costs 6p to feed one cow on grass per day.They also feed the cattle a special "cake" which costs Â£200 for 1000kg. Technology also helps to keep the milk clean because the teat cups automatically stop working if they fall off into the dirt.The milk is stored in 3 big tanks,each holding 2600litres,and is collected by Wootton Bassett dairy.There are 222 cows altogether and 1 Holstein bull.They have been limited by EEC milk quotas.
